docTitle.titlePart:
STATISTICAL ANALYSIS AND ROBUST OPTIMIZATION
OF FORMING PROCESSES
AND FORMING-TO-CRASH PROCESS CHAINS

byline.docAuthor:
T. Clees
1*
, D. Steffes-lai
1
, M. Helbig
2
, D.-Z. Sun
2

byline.affiliation:
1
Fraunhofer Institute for Algorithms and Scientific Computing SCAI

2
Fraunhofer Institute for Mechanics of Materials IWM

front.div:
ABSTRACT: In this paper, a novel strategy for statistical analysis and multi-objective robust design-parameter
optimization of forming processes as well as forming-to-crash process chains is discussed and results presented for a
ZStE340 metal blank of a B-pillar. The strategy comprises both physical experiments and numerical simulation and is
built upon a novel material and damage model as well as several software tools which allow for an efficient sensitivity,
stability and robustness analysis, even for simulation results on highly resolved grids.
front.keyword: KEYWORDS: simulation, material modeling, process chains, random fields, robust design, sensitivity, optimization.
